text:
For an investment horizon equal to the bond's Macaulay duration of 6, the horizon
return is equal to the original YTM of 10.5%. For a shorter three-year investment
horizon, the price increase from a reduction in the YTM to 9.5% dominates the
decrease in reinvestment income so the horizon return, 11.520%, is greater than the
original YTM. For an investor who holds the bond to maturity, there is no price effect
and the decrease in reinvestment income reduces the horizon return to 10.253%, less
than the original YTM.
